column4: yellow all, quick question, can I use packages designed for debian or  should I compile from source?
try to avoid debian packages - what do you need to install?
hmm - compiling might be necessary unless you want to risk a debian unstable package
does apt-cache search come up empty?
the package you want isn't on warty as far as I can see - can't speak for hoary
check the properties by right clicking, and compare to the known path and options?
it's usual to ask before sending dcc chat requests...
what did you want to ask about?
you should see a lot of files
you want the executable - probably in /usr/bin
what does the menu entry say? (right click- properties - command)
I don't think that's necessary - what are you wanting to know?
do you know the command (I don't know limewire) ?
man limewire or limewire --help might give you a hint
try saving your session on logout
